body:
I had access to this account for 5 years and kept it around as a backup. Reddit changed the passwords on it plus other accounts I had last night. I know they did it because I used safari's password manager to generate and store the password, which no longer works:

reddit does way more than ban accounts, their admins literally will change passwords on accounts to stop you from using them without making it a suspension. Imagine if amazon changed your account passwords because you left them a bad review.
body_html:
I had access to this account for 5 years and kept it around as a backup. Reddit changed the passwords on it plus other accounts I had last night. I know they did it because I used safari's password manager to generate and store the password, which no longer works:

reddit does way more than ban accounts, their admins literally will change passwords on accounts to stop you from using them without making it a suspension. Imagine if amazon changed your account passwords because you left them a bad review.
title: Not only will reddit ban accounts for "evading the content policy," they will change the passwords on accounts that you have that are clean and don't have any strikes against it.

body:
They did this to me a few years ago, all my accounts got permabanned and the passwords were changed. Trying to make a new account would result in never logging into the account, and it would also have the wrong password. And for a while the admins banned any of my new accounts that I successfully made on sight.

Now I got suspended again, and some of the new accounts I made after that also had the password reset.

body: I remember you from the modhelp thread about their "anti-evil operations," aka censorship. Ironically my feud with reddit started a half decade ago when I outed one of their employees for posting white supremacist content on "blind," the employee chat app that uses employer emails for verification.
